Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk tracker
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: tracker bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: Tracker is a powerful desktop-neutral first class object database, tag and metadata database, search tool, and indexer. It consists of a common object database that allows entities to have an almost infinite number of properties, metadata (both embedded and harvested, as well as user definable), a comprehensive database of keywords and tags, and links to other entities. It provides additional features for file-based objects including context linking and audit trails for a file object. It has the ability to index, store, and harvest metadata, retrieve and search all types of files and other first class objects. This update fixes the following bugs: Prior to this update, the tracker-miner-fs utility used invalid memory addresses. As a consequence, tracker-miner-fs could terminate unexpectedly with a segmentation fault. The bug in the memory management has been fixed, and the described crashes no longer occur. (BZ#1096307) Previously, the tracker-store utility incorrectly handled failures to open the SQLite database. Consequently, tracker-store terminated unexpectedly with a backtrace. This bug has been fixed, and tracker-store no longer crashes in this scenario. (BZ#1083199) Users of tracker are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
